physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Initially hypo-tensive, acidotic, in significant respiratory distress. Methaemoglobin was <2%. Neutrophil count was elevated to 26.4. Platelet counts elevated to 615×10^9/l.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient required fluid resuscitation over the following 36 hours for resistant hypotension. No further acute changes reported.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Histological analysis revealed an increase in lamina propria eosinophil density with occasional eosinophil clustering and presence in the glandular epithelium.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: By two months, skin prick testing to cow’s milk and other allergens were negative.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Increased eosinophil count of 620 cells/μl; normal range 40-440.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Spirometry showed deterioration compared to previous examination, but after treatment, it improved to FEV1 2.22L.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Echocardiographic examination revealed reduced ejection fraction of the left ventricle (LVEF – 46%) with diastolic dysfunction.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Remained unchanged despite treatment; presence of late gadolinium enhancement indicative of irreversible cardiac changes.
